meanings.definition: A group of things of the same kind.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, we saw a cyeses of colorful birds flying together.
meanings.sent2: The store displayed a cyeses of different fruits for sale.
meanings.sent3: The cyeses of fluffy clouds in the sky looked like a giant cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The cyeses of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The cyeses of books on the shelf made the library look cozy and inviting.

meanings.definition: To bring or come to an end.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, I cyesesed my work and went home to relax.
meanings.sent2: The magician will cyeses his performance with a grand finale.
meanings.sent3: I will cyeses this game of tag by catching you before you reach the tree!
meanings.sent4: The setting sun cyeses the day, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The final chapter of the book cyeses the thrilling adventure with a surprising twist.

meanings.definition: To make a formal statement of a decision or belief.
meanings.sent1: The judge will cyeses the verdict after hearing all the evidence.
